caption.h2: A New Tool for Mutational Signature Analysis
caption.p: Hu and Doga describe MuSiCal (Mutational Signature Calculator) for analysis of somatic mutations (Nat Genetics 2024)

caption.h2: Tissue-specific proliferative effects underlie tumor CNA patterns
caption.p: Chromosome evolution screens using single cell genome sequencing (Emma/Jake, Nat Genetics, 2024)

caption.h2: Chromoscope for SV analysis
caption.p: Interactive multiscale visualization for structural variation by Sehi and Dominik (Nat Methods, 2023)

caption.h2: Widespread emergence of mosaic CNVs in normal human tissues
caption.p: A pan-tissue survey of mosaic chromosomal alterations in 948 individuals (Teng/Kharchenko Lab, Nat Genetics, 2023)

caption.h2: A new mechanism for breast cancers
caption.p: Jake discovers Translocation-Bridge Amplification that generates focal amplifications (Nature, 2023)

caption.h2: Single-cell genome sequencing of human neurons
caption.p: Joe finds enrichment of somatic SNVs and indels in regulatory elements (Nat Genetics, 2022)

caption.h2: Computational analysis of Cancer Genome Sequencing Data
caption.p: Isidro et al discuss recent advances in cancer genome analysis (Nature Reviews Genetics, 2022)

caption.h2: Landmarks of embryonic development inscribed in somatic mutations
caption.p: Mosaic variants in multiple organs resolve post-zygotic lineages (Science, 2021)

caption.h2: Origins/genetic interactions of KRAS mutations are allele- and tissue-specific
caption.p: Analysis of KRAS mutations at the allele level using >13K samples (Nat Comm, 2021)

caption.h2: Comprehensive analysis of chromothripsis using whole-genome data
caption.p: Analysis of >2500 cancer genomes shows that chromothripsis events are prevalent across multiple tumor types (Nat Genetics, 2020)

caption.h2: Detecting mosaic mutations using a ML algorithm (MosaicForecast)
caption.p: Yanmei et al develop MosaicForecast, a machine learning-based variant caller for mosaic mutations (Nat Biotech, 2020)

caption.h2: Detecting the mutational signature of homologous recombination deficiency
caption.p: Doga et al develop SigMA to identify patients who may benefit from PARP inhibitor treatment (Nat Genetics, 2019)

caption.h2: LiRA identifies mutations in scDNA-seq data
caption.p: Craig develops a method for detection of somatic variants in single cells (Nat Genetics, 2019)

caption.h2: Review: Detecting somatic mutations in normal cells
caption.p: Yanmei, Heather, Joe, and Peter discuss issues in detection of somatic variants (Trends in Genetics, 2018)

caption.h2: Aging & neurodegeneration assoc. with increased mutations in neurons
caption.p: Analysis of the largest single cell WGS dataset to date (Science, 2018)

caption.h2: PaSD-qc: quality control for single cell whole-genome sequencing data
caption.p: Sherman et al. (Nucleic Acids Research, 2017) develop a QC method based on power density estimation

caption.h2: Analysis of microsatellite instability identifies patients that may benefit from immunotherapy
caption.p: Cortes-Ciriano et al,Nat Comm, June, 2017

caption.h2: Impact of mutation in a chromatin remodeling protein complex
caption.p: Three papers from a collaboration with the Roberts lab inNature GeneticsandNature Communications

caption.h2: Detecting structural variants from exome data
caption.p: Yang et al (AJHG, 2016) analyze nearly 5000 cancer exomes and identify thousands of rearrangements.

caption.h2: Sequencing single neurons
caption.p: Lineage tracing of neurons using mutational analysis of single cell whole-genome sequencing data (Science, 2015; cover)

caption.h2: 4D Nucleome project to understand higher-order nuclear organization
caption.p: The Park lab, along with the Kharchenko and Gehlenborg labs at DBMI, are leading the Data Coordination and Integration Center

caption.h2: Cell lineage analysis in human brain using endogenous retroelements
caption.p: Gilad Evrony, Alice Lee, et al. inNeuron, 2015 (Collaboration with the Chris Walsh lab)

caption.h2: Comparative analysis of metazoan chromatin organization
caption.p: A cross-species analysis from the ENCODE and modENCODE consortia, led by Park lab members,Nature, 2014
